snippet: Clashes in the northern French city of Amiens could represent a challenge to President François Hollande in a time of joblessness and flat economic growth.
abstract: French Pres Francois Hollande says that his Socialist government will do everything necessary to ensure that law and order prevail after rioting overnight by youths in the northern city of Amiens; clashes, which left 17 police officers injured, could represent a challenge to Hollande in a time of joblessness and flat economic growth.
lead_paragraph: Clashes in the northern French city of Amiens could represent a challenge to President François Hollande in a time of joblessness and flat economic growth.

headline.seo: François Hollande Pledges Order After Rioting in Northern France
headline.main: French Leader Promises Order After Youths Riot in a Northern City
headline.print_headline: French Leader Promises Order After Youths Riot in a Northern City
